title: How to Make Sour Cream Cornbread

methods.name: Making Basic Sour Cream Cornbread Loaves

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and prepare the pans.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 350 degrees F (180 C). Get out two 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2-inch (21 x 11 x 3 cm) loaf pans and spray them with cooking spray. Cut parchment paper to fit the pans and press the paper into them. Set the pans aside while you make the batter.

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description:
Get out a large mixing bowl and measure 3 cups (375 g) of all-purpose flour into it. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and whisk them until the ingredients are combined. You'll need to add<
1 cup (120 g) medium-grind yellow cornmeal
1/2 cup (100 g) sugar
2 tablespoons baking powder
1 tablespoon kosher salt

steps.headline: Whisk the wet ingredients with the melted butter.
steps.description: Melt 1 cup (226 g) of unsalted butter in a small bowl and set it aside. Get out a medium-sized mixing bowl and pour in 1 1/4 cups (295 ml) of whole milk. Add 3/4 cup (172 g) of sour cream and 2 extra-large eggs. Whisk the wet ingredients until the eggs are incorporated. Slowly whisk in the melted butter. Try to have the eggs at room temperature before you whisk them in. This will improve the texture of the cornbread loaves.

steps.headline: Combine the wet and dry ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the wet mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and use a rubber spatula to stir them together. Stir until the dry ingredients are totally mixed in and you can't see any flour. Avoid over mixing the batter or the cornbread loaves could become coarse and tough.

steps.headline: Spread the batter in the pans.
steps.description: Divide the batter between the two prepared loaf pans. Use a knife or offset spatula to smooth the tops, so the loaves are level. To ensure that you divide the batter evenly, you can use measuring cups to scoop the batter into the pans.

steps.headline: Bake the cornbread loaves.
steps.description: Put the pans in the oven and bake the cornbread for 35 to 40 minutes. They should turn golden brown. Wear hot pads and remove the cornbread from the oven. Let the pans cool completely on a wire rack before you serve the cornbread. You can test for doneness by sticking a toothpick or skewer into the loaves. The toothpick should come out clean when the cornbread is done. If batter sticks to it, it should bake for a few more minutes.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and prepare a skillet.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 350 degrees F (180 C). Spread a little vegetable oil in a 9-inch (23-cm) cast-iron skillet, so the cornbread won't stick. Set the skillet aside while you make the cornbread batter.

steps.headline: Whisk the wet ingredients with the onion and corn.
steps.description: Get out a large mixing bowl and pour in 2⁄3 cup (157 ml) of vegetable oil. Measure out 1 cup (230 g) of sour cream and add it along with 2 large lightly beaten eggs. Grate 1 medium yellow onion and add it to the bowl. You should also open and add 1 15-ounce (418 g) can of creamed corn. Whisk all of the wet ingredients until they're combined. Ensure that you're using creamed corn, not sweet kernel corn.

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a separate bowl, place 1 1⁄2 cups (180 g) of yellow cornmeal. Add 2 teaspoons of baking powder and 1 teaspoon of kosher salt. Whisk the dry ingredients, so the baking powder and salt are distributed in the flour.

steps.headline: Combine the wet and dry ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients. Use a rubber spatula to stir them together. The flour should be incorporated, but the batter will be a little lumpy. Avoid stirring too much, since this could make the cornbread tough.

steps.headline: Spread the batter in the pan and sprinkle cheese on top.
steps.description: Scrape the batter into the prepared skillet and smooth the top with the spatula. Sprinkle 1 cup (100 g) of grated cheddar cheese over the cornbread. You could also use your favorite hard or melting cheese.

steps.headline: Bake the savory sour cream cornbread.
steps.description: Put the skillet in the oven and bake it for 45 minutes. It should turn golden brown. If you stick a tester into it, the tester should come out clean (without batter sticking to it). Let the cornbread cool for 20 minutes on a wire rack before you serve it.

methods.name: Making Sweet and Moist Sour Cream Cornbread

steps.headline: Heat the oven and the skillet.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 425 degrees F (220 C). Move the racks of the oven, so one rack is in the center. Put a 10-inch (25 cm) cast-iron skillet in the center rack of the oven as it heats. Heating the pan will give the cornbread a crisp crust.

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description:
Get out a large mixing bowl and place 1 cup (120 g) of yellow cornmeal and 1 cup (125 g) of all-purpose flour in it. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and whisk them completely. You'll need to add:
1/2 cup (100 g) sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon baking soda

steps.headline: Whisk the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Get out a medium-sized mixing bowl and melt 3 tablespoons of butter in it. Add 3/4 cup (172 g) of sour cream, 1/2 cup (120 ml) of buttermilk, 2 large eggs, and 2 tablespoons canola oil. Whisk the wet ingredients until they're combined.

steps.headline: Combine the wet and dry ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the wet mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and use a rubber spatula to stir them together. Stir until the dry ingredients are totally mixed in and you can't see any flour. Avoid over mixing the batter or the cornbread could become coarse and tough.

steps.headline: Spread the batter in the hot skillet.
steps.description: Wear hot pads and take the hot skillet out of the oven. Put the remaining tablespoon of butter in the skillet and tilt the pan, so the butter melts and greases the pan. Spread the batter in the pan.

steps.headline: Bake the sweet and moist sour cream cornbread.
steps.description: Return the skillet to the oven and bake the cornbread for 20 minutes. A tester or toothpick should come out clean once the cornbread is finished. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes in the skillet. You can serve the cornbread from the skillet. If you'd like to put the cornbread on a serving plate, just flip it out onto a large plate and flip it back over. Slice the cornbread and serve it from the plate.

text:
Making Basic Sour Cream Cornbread Loaves Preheat the oven and prepare the pans. Turn the oven on to 350 degrees F (180 C). Get out two 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2-inch (21 x 11 x 3 cm) loaf pans and spray them with cooking spray. Cut parchment paper to fit the pans and press the paper into them. Set the pans aside while you make the batter. Whisk the dry ingredients. Get out a large mixing bowl and measure 3 cups (375 g) of all-purpose flour into it. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and whisk them until the ingredients are combined. You'll need to add<
1 cup (120 g) medium-grind yellow cornmeal
1/2 cup (100 g) sugar
2 tablespoons baking powder
1 tablespoon kosher salt Whisk the wet ingredients with the melted butter. Melt 1 cup (226 g) of unsalted butter in a small bowl and set it aside. Get out a medium-sized mixing bowl and pour in 1 1/4 cups (295 ml) of whole milk. Add 3/4 cup (172 g) of sour cream and 2 extra-large eggs. Whisk the wet ingredients until the eggs are incorporated. Slowly whisk in the melted butter. Try to have the eggs at room temperature before you whisk them in. This will improve the texture of the cornbread loaves. Combine the wet and dry ingredients. Pour the wet mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and use a rubber spatula to stir them together. Stir until the dry ingredients are totally mixed in and you can't see any flour. Avoid over mixing the batter or the cornbread loaves could become coarse and tough. Spread the batter in the pans. Divide the batter between the two prepared loaf pans. Use a knife or offset spatula to smooth the tops, so the loaves are level. To ensure that you divide the batter evenly, you can use measuring cups to scoop the batter into the pans. Bake the cornbread loaves. Put the pans in the oven and bake the cornbread for 35 to 40 minutes. They should turn golden brown. Wear hot pads and remove the cornbread from the oven. Let the pans cool completely on a wire rack before you serve the cornbread. You can test for doneness by sticking a toothpick or skewer into the loaves. The toothpick should come out clean when the cornbread is done. If batter sticks to it, it should bake for a few more minutes. Making Savory Sour Cream Cornbread Preheat the oven and prepare a skillet. Turn the oven on to 350 degrees F (180 C). Spread a little vegetable oil in a 9-inch (23-cm) cast-iron skillet, so the cornbread won't stick. Set the skillet aside while you make the cornbread batter. Whisk the wet ingredients with the onion and corn. Get out a large mixing bowl and pour in 2⁄3 cup (157 ml) of vegetable oil. Measure out 1 cup (230 g) of sour cream and add it along with 2 large lightly beaten eggs. Grate 1 medium yellow onion and add it to the bowl. You should also open and add 1 15-ounce (418 g) can of creamed corn. Whisk all of the wet ingredients until they're combined. Ensure that you're using creamed corn, not sweet kernel corn. Whisk the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, place 1 1⁄2 cups (180 g) of yellow cornmeal. Add 2 teaspoons of baking powder and 1 teaspoon of kosher salt. Whisk the dry ingredients, so the baking powder and salt are distributed in the flour. Combine the wet and dry ingredients. Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients. Use a rubber spatula to stir them together. The flour should be incorporated, but the batter will be a little lumpy. Avoid stirring too much, since this could make the cornbread tough. Spread the batter in the pan and sprinkle cheese on top. Scrape the batter into the prepared skillet and smooth the top with the spatula. Sprinkle 1 cup (100 g) of grated cheddar cheese over the cornbread. You could also use your favorite hard or melting cheese. Bake the savory sour cream cornbread. Put the skillet in the oven and bake it for 45 minutes. It should turn golden brown. If you stick a tester into it, the tester should come out clean (without batter sticking to it). Let the cornbread cool for 20 minutes on a wire rack before you serve it. Making Sweet and Moist Sour Cream Cornbread Heat the oven and the skillet. Turn the oven on to 425 degrees F (220 C). Move the racks of the oven, so one rack is in the center. Put a 10-inch (25 cm) cast-iron skillet in the center rack of the oven as it heats. Heating the pan will give the cornbread a crisp crust. Whisk the dry ingredients. Get out a large mixing bowl and place 1 cup (120 g) of yellow cornmeal and 1 cup (125 g) of all-purpose flour in it. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and whisk them completely. You'll need to add:
1/2 cup (100 g) sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon baking soda Whisk the wet ingredients. Get out a medium-sized mixing bowl and melt 3 tablespoons of butter in it. Add 3/4 cup (172 g) of sour cream, 1/2 cup (120 ml) of buttermilk, 2 large eggs, and 2 tablespoons canola oil. Whisk the wet ingredients until they're combined. Combine the wet and dry ingredients. Pour the wet mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and use a rubber spatula to stir them together. Stir until the dry ingredients are totally mixed in and you can't see any flour. Avoid over mixing the batter or the cornbread could become coarse and tough. Spread the batter in the hot skillet. Wear hot pads and take the hot skillet out of the oven. Put the remaining tablespoon of butter in the skillet and tilt the pan, so the butter melts and greases the pan. Spread the batter in the pan. Bake the sweet and moist sour cream cornbread. Return the skillet to the oven and bake the cornbread for 20 minutes. A tester or toothpick should come out clean once the cornbread is finished. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes in the skillet. You can serve the cornbread from the skillet. If you'd like to put the cornbread on a serving plate, just flip it out onto a large plate and flip it back over. Slice the cornbread and serve it from the plate.
sentences: Making Basic Sour Cream Cornbread Loaves Preheat the oven and prepare the pans.
Turn the oven on to 350 degrees F (180 C).
Get out two 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2-inch (21 x 11 x 3 cm) loaf pans and spray them with cooking spray.
Cut parchment paper to fit the pans and press the paper into them.
Set the pans aside while you make the batter.
Whisk the dry ingredients.
Get out a large mixing bowl and measure 3 cups (375 g) of all-purpose flour into it.
Add the rest of the dry ingredients and whisk them until the ingredients are combined.

You'll need to add<
1 cup (120 g) medium-grind yellow cornmeal
1/2 cup (100 g) sugar
2 tablespoons baking powder
1 tablespoon kosher salt Whisk the wet ingredients with the melted butter.
Melt 1 cup (226 g) of unsalted butter in a small bowl and set it aside.
Get out a medium-sized mixing bowl and pour in 1 1/4 cups (295 ml) of whole milk.
Add 3/4 cup (172 g) of sour cream and 2 extra-large eggs.
Whisk the wet ingredients until the eggs are incorporated.
Slowly whisk in the melted butter.
Try to have the eggs at room temperature before you whisk them in.
This will improve the texture of the cornbread loaves.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients.
Pour the wet mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and use a rubber spatula to stir them together.
Stir until the dry ingredients are totally mixed in and you can't see any flour.
Avoid over mixing the batter or the cornbread loaves could become coarse and tough.
Spread the batter in the pans.
Divide the batter between the two prepared loaf pans.
Use a knife or offset spatula to smooth the tops, so the loaves are level.
To ensure that you divide the batter evenly, you can use measuring cups to scoop the batter into the pans.
Bake the cornbread loaves.
Put the pans in the oven and bake the cornbread for 35 to 40 minutes.
They should turn golden brown.
Wear hot pads and remove the cornbread from the oven.
Let the pans cool completely on a wire rack before you serve the cornbread.
You can test for doneness by sticking a toothpick or skewer into the loaves.
The toothpick should come out clean when the cornbread is done.
If batter sticks to it, it should bake for a few more minutes.
Making Savory Sour Cream Cornbread Preheat the oven and prepare a skillet.
Turn the oven on to 350 degrees F (180 C).
Spread a little vegetable oil in a 9-inch (23-cm) cast-iron skillet, so the cornbread won't stick.
Set the skillet aside while you make the cornbread batter.
Whisk the wet ingredients with the onion and corn.
Get out a large mixing bowl and pour in 2⁄3 cup (157 ml) of vegetable oil.
Measure out 1 cup (230 g) of sour cream and add it along with 2 large lightly beaten eggs.
Grate 1 medium yellow onion and add it to the bowl.
You should also open and add 1 15-ounce (418 g) can of creamed corn.
Whisk all of the wet ingredients until they're combined.
Ensure that you're using creamed corn, not sweet kernel corn.
Whisk the dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, place 1 1⁄2 cups (180 g) of yellow cornmeal.
Add 2 teaspoons of baking powder and 1 teaspoon of kosher salt.
Whisk the dry ingredients, so the baking powder and salt are distributed in the flour.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients.
Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients.
Use a rubber spatula to stir them together.
The flour should be incorporated, but the batter will be a little lumpy.
Avoid stirring too much, since this could make the cornbread tough.
Spread the batter in the pan and sprinkle cheese on top.
Scrape the batter into the prepared skillet and smooth the top with the spatula.
Sprinkle 1 cup (100 g) of grated cheddar cheese over the cornbread.
You could also use your favorite hard or melting cheese.
Bake the savory sour cream cornbread.
Put the skillet in the oven and bake it for 45 minutes.
It should turn golden brown.
If you stick a tester into it, the tester should come out clean (without batter sticking to it).
Let the cornbread cool for 20 minutes on a wire rack before you serve it.
Making Sweet and Moist Sour Cream Cornbread Heat the oven and the skillet.
Turn the oven on to 425 degrees F (220 C).
Move the racks of the oven, so one rack is in the center.
Put a 10-inch (25 cm) cast-iron skillet in the center rack of the oven as it heats.
Heating the pan will give the cornbread a crisp crust.
Whisk the dry ingredients.
Get out a large mixing bowl and place 1 cup (120 g) of yellow cornmeal and 1 cup (125 g) of all-purpose flour in it.
Add the rest of the dry ingredients and whisk them completely.

You'll need to add:
1/2 cup (100 g) sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon baking soda Whisk the wet ingredients.
Get out a medium-sized mixing bowl and melt 3 tablespoons of butter in it.
Add 3/4 cup (172 g) of sour cream, 1/2 cup (120 ml) of buttermilk, 2 large eggs, and 2 tablespoons canola oil.
Whisk the wet ingredients until they're combined.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients.
Pour the wet mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients and use a rubber spatula to stir them together.
Stir until the dry ingredients are totally mixed in and you can't see any flour.
Avoid over mixing the batter or the cornbread could become coarse and tough.
Spread the batter in the hot skillet.
Wear hot pads and take the hot skillet out of the oven.
Put the remaining tablespoon of butter in the skillet and tilt the pan, so the butter melts and greases the pan.
Spread the batter in the pan.
Bake the sweet and moist sour cream cornbread.
Return the skillet to the oven and bake the cornbread for 20 minutes.
A tester or toothpick should come out clean once the cornbread is finished.
Remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes in the skillet.
You can serve the cornbread from the skillet.
If you'd like to put the cornbread on a serving plate, just flip it out onto a large plate and flip it back over.
Slice the cornbread and serve it from the plate.
